District News and Alerts:
I am informing parents that a family member of a child in Mrs. Cansler's Kindergarten class has tested positive for Covid-19 (I repeat-a family member, not the child). The child has tested negative and has shown no symptoms. Our policy states that the child, although not showing symptoms, will stay at home for two weeks. I have contacted the county health department and they say that the rest of the children in the class are considered "non-contact" and are at very minimal risk. To their credit, our elementary staff has done a great job of keeping grade levels separate. We also sanitize constantly throughout the day-wiping with disinfectant and using electrostatic sprayers. If you have questions, please feel free to contact the elementary school.
--Mr. Johnson

We have 10 full days off until school will resume. We will keep you updated as new information becomes available. ALL conferences, PK-12, are postponed, tonight.

post_text: Promenade for the 2019 Junior-Senior Prom will begin at 7:00pm on April 12th. Attendees will promenade between the old gym and the band room. The parking lot in front of the new gym will be blocked off for student parking only. Please be respectful of parking signs so the students attending prom will be able to park with easy access to the school. No one will be allowed into the school building unless they have received an invitation to prom. We will make every effort to post pictures of prom, so all may see the decorations. If you would like to take pictures with your child this needs to be done prior to them being announced for promenade so that they may go directly into prom. Prom picture forms are available in the high school office, and must be filled out with payment the night of prom. Please remind your child to get a form if you want pictures. We are so excited about this year's prom and want it to be a wonderful memory for our students.

BF-DC Academic Team
February 2, 2019 at 4:37 PM ·

Today the Burns Flat-Dill City High School Academic Team placed 3rd at the OSSAA 2A State Academic Meet! They played hard all day and did amazing. This wraps up an amazing season! They received District and Regional Championships and Area Runner up. They also received Conference Championship at the Oklahoma Great Plains Academic Conference. They had a season record of 27 wins to 3 losses. Placing 3rd at State means they are 3rd put of the 96 schools in 2A. This team has had an amazing season and we are all very proud of them. Go Eagles!

January 19, 2019 at 8:04 PM ·

Congratulations to BFDC Show team. We had a very good weekend with our livestock projects at the Elk City Regional Livestock Show.

Jessica Briggs - 1st place, Champion Black Face, Grand Champion Lamb

Lorsa Hughes - 3rd place and 6th place black face lambs

Allie Dixon - 4th place and 6th place black face lambs

Colin Walters - 8th place doe goat (1st time ever showing)

Haylee Davis - Champion Crossbred Steer and Reserve Grand Champion Steer

Autumn Collins and Jimmy Jackson didn't make the main ring, but had some really good looks with their gilts being in their 1st year showing pigs.
